description:
When I working on Openstack, I noticed that mysql data size keep increase. 
Looks like nova never delete records from mysql for deleted instances.
Is this a bug ?
Or it designed to work like this ?
If it is designed to work like this,  why ?
title: nova never delete records in mysql

comments.content:
When I working on Openstack, I noticed that mysql data size keep increase. 
Looks like nova never delete records from mysql for deleted instances.
Is this a bug ?
Or it designed to work like this ?
If it is designed to work like this,  why ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~chen-li

comments.content: This is expected.  Nova also has shadow tables where you can archive rows.  Try ask.openstack.org or the openstack mailing list for more information on this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb
